channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fortune 500 auto parts supplier Lear looks to slash some 15,000 jobs this year globally
item.description: The company is also looking to drive growth by winning new business from the one group of automakers most likely to grow in the near future: Chinese d...

item.title: How Emily Sundberg’s ‘Feed Me’ Newsletter Made Her Into a Rising Substack Star
item.description: Emily Sundberg’s business newsletter, Feed Me, has made her a rising Substack star.

item.title: White House Forces Showdown Over Congress’s Power of the Purse
item.description: The confirmation of Russell T. Vought to lead the powerful White House budget office is likely to escalate the funding fights roiling Washington and t...

item.title: Former Adams Aide to Plead Guilty to Conspiracy in Straw Donations Case
item.description: The aide, Mohamed Bahi, had been accused of telling a witness to lie to federal agents investigating illegal contributions to the mayor’s campaign.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil Shortly After Takeoff
item.description: Two people were killed and six were injured by a plane crash in the middle of the street in São Paolo.

item.title: Elon Musk appears to consider reinstating the 25-year-old DOGE staffer who resigned after being linked to a racist social media account
item.description: The statements Musk is seemingly referring to include posts calling to normalize “Indian hate" and one suggesting Gaza and Israel be “wiped off the fa...

item.title: Dozens of Clinical Trials Have Been Frozen in Response to Trump’s USAID Order
item.description: The stop-work order on U.S.A.I.D.-funded research has left thousands of people with experimental drugs and devices in their bodies, with no access to ...

item.title: Trump Envoy Pushes Lebanon’s New Leaders to Isolate Hezbollah
item.description: Hezbollah, a powerful Iran-backed militia, has long been the country’s dominant political force and has formed part of the government for decades.

item.title: A workforce management giant will lay off 1,750 employees to make way for AI
item.description: Nearly 8.5% of staffers will be affected, joining the ranks of Salesforce and Klarna in paving a new way of work.

item.title: Is the market rooting for Kansas City? History shows stocks gain 21% when Chiefs play in the Super Bowl

item.title: A 311-Year-Old Stradivarius Violin Sells for $11.25 Million at Sotheby’s

item.title: She helped get Black-owned brands on store shelves. Even as the tide turns against DEI, she’s determined to keep them there
item.description: Target's DEI pivot was received the worst by consumers of any company's.

item.title: Plane Crashes Into Street in Brazil, Killing 2
item.description: Six people on the ground were also injured by the plane, part of which struck a bus on the road when it crashed.

item.title: How Many Federal Worker Resignations Would Be a Lot?
item.description: Sixty-five thousand have submitted resignations as part of Elon Musk’s “fork in the road” offer. But 150,000 voluntarily leave every year anyway.

item.title: Congo Buries Its Dead After Rebel Assault
item.description: A single image captures the grim task facing those who needed to find space for the dead after a spasm of violence in Central Africa.
